isis.stitle: SUSPENSION ALIGNMENT - REAR AXLE ALIGNMENT - STRAIGHTEDGE AND TRAMMEL

svcproc.title: STRAIGHTEDGE AND TRAMMEL
svcproc.para: The following alignment check (measuring of the suspension) applies to:
All tandem suspensions covered in this manual.
All 4x2 vehicles having spring suspensions with torque rods.
All International air suspensions with tapered leaf springs.
In the event axle adjustment is necessary, refer to REAR AXLE ADJUSTMENT and the appropriate procedure for the suspension being serviced.

step1.para: Clamp a straightedge to top of frame rail ahead of forward rear axle on 6x4 vehicles and ahead of rear axles on 4x2 vehicles. Use a framing square against straightedge and outside surface of frame sidemember to insure straightedge is perpendicular to frame as in Figure 9.
Suspend a plumb bob from the straightedge in front of the tire and on outboard side of the forward rear axle on 6x4 vehicles or rear axle on 4x2 vehicles ( Figure 10).

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. SUSPEND PLUMB BOB AT THIS LOCATION

step1.para: Position a slotted bar such that pointers are engaged in center hole of forward rear axle (6x4) or rear axle (4x2) and plumb line ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Measure Distance From Plumb Bob Line And Centerline Of Axle, 4X2 Chassis

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. SUSPEND PLUMB BOB AT THIS LOCATION

step1.para: Measure distance between cord of plumb bob and pointer on forward rear axle of 6x4 vehicles or rear axle on 4x2 vehicles. Record dimension "P" as in Figure 12.

figure.caption: Figure 12. Measure Dimensions "P" And "D," 6X4 Vehicle Illustrated

step1.para: Position slotted bar with pointers on opposite side of vehicle in same manner and measure corresponding distance as in Step 4. Record dimension "D".
Refer to Figure 1, Figure 2, Figure 3, Figure 4, and Figure 5 for proper measurements in regard to rear axle alignment.
Refer to the . REAR AXLE ADJUSTMENT in this section for procedures to correct alignment problems.

svcproc.para: This completes the adjustment of a forward rear axle (tandem suspension) or rear axle on a 4x2 chassis.
Continue for the alignment procedures for rear rear axle on a 6x4 chassis.

step1.para: Position slotted bar one side of vehicle so that pointers are engaged in center hole of both rear axles ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Position Bar With Pointers Centered In Both Rear Axles

step1.para: Position slotted bar on opposite side of vehicle with the same pointer being used ( Figure 14). With the pointer in forward rear axle center, the other pointer must be within 1/8 inch of rear rear axle center line mark.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Check Dimension On Opposite Side Of Rear Axles, Within 1/8 Inch

step1.para: Any difference in dimensions from side to side must be equalized if in excess of 1/8 inch.
Refer to REAR AXLE ADJUSTMENT for procedures to equalize differences.
After alignment adjustments have been completed, road test the vehicle and make corrections if needed.
